text: Peel the ginger, mince it and cut it into small pieces.  Wash the peel of the lime gently. Peel the lime and retain the zest. Pour the water into the saucepan. Add the sugar, minced ginger and lime peel. Cook the mixture over low heat. Cook until it turns into a syrup. Stir frequently; it should thicken after about 10-15 minutes. Remove from the heat then. Wash the strawberries. Place them in the blender or food processor. Blend or process until they form a thick juice. Strain the syrup to remove the pulp. Pour the strained syrup into the strawberry puree. Mix well then place the mixture into the fridge to chill.  Serve direct from the fridge to preserve its freshness. Mix again before serving, then pour equal amounts into four soup bowls. Garnish with a mint leaf for each bowl of strawberry and lime soup.
